distros.name: Linux Mint
distros.description: Been here for quite a while. Community-driven, stable and familiar. Features the Cinnamon desktop environment. Works well even on 10-15 years old computers (with an SSD) designed for Windows 8/10/11.

distros.name: Kubuntu
distros.description: A well established and trusted distro, based on Ubuntu with the KDE Plasma desktop environment. Similar requirements to Linux Mint.

distros.name: Zorin OS
distros.description: A polished distro focused on visual appeal, featuring the Gnome desktop environment with many out-of-the-box layouts, including a Windows-like one. Similar requirements to Linux Mint.

distros.name: Pop!_OS
distros.description: Built by System76, featuring the Cosmic desktop environment (MacOS-like) and focusing on usability.

distros.name: Aurora
distros.description: A user-friendly stable and immutable (making it harder to break) distro - the future of the Linux desktop. Features the KDE Plasma desktop environment. An alternative to yet unreleased KDE Linux.

distros.name: KDE Linux
distros.description: A Linux distribution built by KDE. Immutable (using Btrfs snapshots), stable and fast. The new era of the Linux desktop. Yet to be released.

distros.name: Fedora
distros.description: Perfect for developers. Comes in many editions/spins, including one with the KDE Plasma desktop environment. Fedora is a semi-rolling distribution, making it both stable and up-to-date. Nvidia drivers installation may not be straightforward.

distros.name: Bluefin
distros.description: Built on top of Fedora atomic, Bluefin is an immutable user-friendly distro, perfect for conteinerized development and daily use.

distros.name: Bazzite
distros.description: A gaming immutable (using OSTree) Linux distribution, perfect for both PCs and handhelds (has a special edition for them). One of the editions features the KDE Plasma desktop environment. Take a survey on the official website to see if your hardware supports Linux gaming.

distros.name: CachyOS
distros.description: An Arch-based distribution optimized for performance, featuring the KDE Plasma desktop environment. Though not initially gaming-ready, it can be easily set up for gaming by installing a single meta package (cachyos-gaming-meta). The handheld edition, on the other hand, is gaming-ready. Perfect for tech enthusiasts, requires some terminal experience.

distros.name: Linux Lite
distros.description: A lightweight Linux distro with a sleek design, featuring the XFCE desktop environment. A minimum of 1GB of RAM is required (more to run apps smoothly). Good for older, slower computers or netbooks (2009 and above) with an HDD and 2-4 Gb of RAM designed for Windows 7/8/10 (if you have an SSD and 4Gb DDR3 RAM it's recommended to use Linux Mint, Zorin OS, or Kubuntu).

distros.name: Lubuntu
distros.description: A user-friendly lightweight Ubuntu variant, perfect for computers produced before 2011 and designed for Windows XP/Vista/7 with 1 or 2Gb of RAM. Slightly lighter than Linux Lite due to using LXQt desktop environment.

distros.name: antiX
distros.description: Ultra light distro, requires as minimum as 256Mb of RAM to run (more to run apps smoothly). Good for ancient computers designed for Windows XP.
